conclusion: Understanding the problem setup with a pedestrian and a bus at a traffic light.
Description of the v-t graph and its significance.
Pedestrian's line is horizontal at 8 m/s, indicating constant velocity.
Bus's line starts at origin and increases linearly, indicating constant acceleration.
Need to determine if the pedestrian can cover the 36-meter gap.
Calculate bus's acceleration as 1 m/s² from the graph.
Determine positions of pedestrian and bus as functions of time.
Set s_p = s_bus to find when the pedestrian catches up.
Solve quadratic equation to find t ≈ 19.66 s.
Bus accelerates to 8 m/s at 8 seconds, then moves at constant velocity.
Realize earlier assumption of indefinite acceleration was incorrect.
